markdownRemark.html:
Score: 92.5

providencejournal.com  (WEB - en-US)

The website of The Providence Journal, one of the oldest newspapers in the country.

This website generally maintains basic standards of credibility and transparency.
Does not repeatedly publish false content
Gathers and presents information responsibly
Regularly corrects or clarifies errors
Handles the difference between news and opinion responsibly
Avoids deceptive headlines
Website discloses ownership and financing
Clearly labels advertising
Reveals who's in charge, including any possible conflicts of interest
The site provides names of content creators, along with either contact or biographical information

Ownership and Financing

The Providence Journal is owned by GateHouse Media, the publishing company of the publicly traded New Media Investment Group. GateHouse publishes more than 140 daily newspapers and more than 330 weekly publications throughout the U.S. GateHouse has added over 100 publications since 2015, primarily daily and weekly newspapers, through acquisitions of several local and regional publishing companies.

GateHouse generates revenue from advertising and subscriptions for printed and digital products. It also operates a number of marketing and production services, such the Center for News & Design, an Austin, Texas-based unit that provides centralized page design, digital production, and copy editing for GateHouse’s newspapers and for external clients.

Content

The ProJo, as it is known locally, covers news, politics, and business in Rhode Island and parts of Massachusetts. Regional coverage includes changes in school budgets, the policies of Governor Gina Raimondo, and state unemployment. The site covers high school and college sports, featuring short profiles of promising athletes. The entertainment section includes reviews of local bars and restaurants, and information about upcoming concerts. Opinion stories provide commentary on state and national issues. The Associated Press provides coverage of national and international news.

The site runs galleries of original photography. Readers can also find obituaries, classified ads, and real estate news. It also publishes articles produced by More Content Now, a GateHouse owned internal wire service that supplies primarily lifestyle related content.

Credibility

The editorial staff writes stories and headlines that are straightforward and factual. News and opinion sections are clearly distinguished. Original photography frequently accompanies stories.

The newspaper and site consistently publish in-depth reporting. The newspaper has won four Pulitzer Prizes, including in 1994 for investigating corruption in the Rhode Island court system. In 2016, the publication was named New England Newspaper of the Year by the New England Newspaper and Press Association. It also won the top award that year for editorials. In 2017 the association honored “Pot & Profit,” a series on the state’s growing medical marijuana industry.

In 2017, the ProJo published an editor’s note retracting a story about a former Rhode Island police chief who had been suspended after an altercation with an officer. The note stated that the story was based on the false account of a retired police officer. The website clearly states  its corrections policy and provides contact information for readers to report errors.

Transparency

The site names authors and provides information about them. Readers can also find names and biographical information about editors and senior staff.

Although traditional advertising on ProvidenceJournal.com is distinguished from editorial content, sponsored content is not always clearly marked. Several articles in the Business section of the site are provided by Brandpoint, a company that produces content that has been paid for by brands mentioned in the stories. The site credits these stories to “BPT,” without little indication to readers that they are actually ads. Some — but not all — stories include disclosures that the site earns commissions if readers click and buy the advertised products. Because it is generally unclear which stories earn commissions for the the site, NewsGuard has determined that it does not clearly label advertising.

In response to NewsGuard inquiries about Gatehouse-owned publications’ practices for identifying sponsored content, Chris Biondi, Gatehouse Media vice president of digital operations and product development, said in an email in October 2018 that GateHouse has implemented a “global fix” to label all sponsored content. However, NewsGuard found that some Brandpoint content on the site continued to be inadequately labeled.

The site discloses its ownership by GateHouse on an Ownership page.

History

The Providence Journal dates to 1829 and is one of the oldest daily newspapers in the country.

Editor's Note: This label has been updated, and the rating changed, after the site changed its About Us page to disclose its ownership by GateHouse. 

Written by:
Evan Haddad

Edited by:
Jim Warren Yemile Bucay
